Ask HN: Recommended crash courses in web UI design (30 minutes or less)
text:
I self taught back end, and can now make full apps with ruby on rails. Unsurprisingly, my finished applications never look quite right. I use bootstrap which helps a lot.

I think the problem is mostly with the layout of elements on the page. I try not to overdo things with unnecessary elements, and am at a point where each individual piece of the webpage (e.g. a button, a logo, a navbar, a form) looks fine on its own, but doesn't look professional as a whole (for reasons I'm not yet perceptive enough to detect - I can tell it's clunky but I can't articulate why).

I know 30 minutes is ambitious, but I'm working on an MVP and don't have a lot of time right now (in the future, absolutely).

Any recommendations for crash courses, videos, articles, or tutorials greatly appreciated! Particularly interested to hear from anyone who wasn't a design 'natural', and had to self teach as I am.

Ask HN: Why don't email verifications ever let me DENY the verification?
text:
I have a name that's apparently common in Europe. Every couple of weeks I get an email asking me to verify/confirm my email address.

They never ever seem to have a button that says "DENY VERIFICATION " or "Nope, that's not me"

Small shops I never heard of and big, international, well known businesses - they never have a "Do not approve / register / verify" button.

(Today I just got half a dozen emails from PayPal - apparently somebody is using my email address to register. Based on subsequent emails, even though this email was never verified, they continue to do their business and register. PayPal won't let me deny usage of my email, submit a ticket, or contact support for help without logging in, which obviously I cannot and do not want to do - I'm not to the one who got registered!).

So what is the point in email verification emails, if there's no way to deny it / indicate "Nope that's not me, don't do it"?

title: Ask HN: HN why don't you open the article in new tab by default?
text:

Tell HN: College students are now considerably more fat
text:
Just wanted to share a personal observation, I dropped out of college in 2012, and went to a coding bootcamp then got a job, worked my way from code monkey to sr dev, got bored after 5 years and thought why not finish degree just needed 1.5 of a semester. When I went back in 2018ish I really noticed how now at least 40% kids were fat. I'm obese too but not Walmart fat. Before there used to be like 2 people among 400. I felt alarmed and sad. I've struggled with weight all my life, don't even eat pizza or touch soda for years. I envy people who complain about not being able to gain weight. So it was sad knowing how much it sucks. So many now are way overweight. Which sucks because being handsome kind of matter more in 20s than say in 40s if you are married and have kids etc.

I also read that even wild animals are getting fatter. That's really big clue, why all humanity is getting obese. Maybe in future we will look back pitifully knowing the true reasons.
